===Etymology===
Originally {{der|zh|yue|-}}. From the supposed resemblance of Portuguese and other European skin tones to ghosts.

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|chiefly|Cantonese|Min Dong|colloquial|pejorative|usually|_|offensive}} [[gweilo]], "[[foreign]] [[devil]]" {{gloss|particularly a [[European]]; a [[Caucasian]]; [[whitey]]}}

====Usage notes====
A derogatory term for white people, particularly men, mainly in speech. Prior to the 1980s, the term was commonly prefixed in Cantonese by {{m|zh|死||tr=sei2|damned}}, with the meaning "[[damned]] [[ghost]] [[fucker]], [[damned]] [[foreign]] [[devil]]".
